Text.text: What is your primary responsibility as an advisee?
Periodically inform your advisor on how your classes are going
Incorrect: this is not your primary requirement as an advisee.
Share information from your advisor with your classmates
Incorrect: this is not your primary requirement as an advisee.
Schedule meetings with your advisor each semester
Correct: each student should meet with his/her advisor each semester for help choosing and enrolling in classes.
You have no responsibilities beyond what your advisor suggests you to do
Incorrect: try again.
What is the advisorâ€™s primary role?
Help the student adjust to campus life
Incorrect: this task is better suited for the Division of Student Life or your resident assistant.
Answer any questions the student has about programs at the university
Incorrect: this task is better suited for the Division of Student Life.
Provide guidance regarding coursework
Correct: this is the primary responsibility of an advisor.
All of the above
Incorrect: not all of these are primary responsibilities of an advisor.
Who is NOT the best person to go to if you're having trouble adjusting to college?
Your advisor
Correct! Your advisor can help you in many ways, but they are not trained to listen to problems which are not related to your classes and your major.
Your resident assistant
Incorrect: if you live in the dorms, your resident assistant can be very helpful with helping you adjust to campus life. Try again!
Center for Counseling and Student Development
Incorrect: the Counseling Center is a safe place for you to talk about any issues you struggle with. Try again!
A close friend
Incorrect: try again!
How often is it suggested for you to meet with an advisor?
Once a year
Incorrect. Try again!
Only when you want to switch your major
Incorrect: your advisor can also help you choose classes to take and decide on a major. Try again!
Once a semester
Correct! It is best to meet with your advisor once a semester to discuss which classes to take and to check that you're on track with your degree requirements.
Three times a semester
Incorrect: try again!
